Wisdom: الْإِطْرَاءُ يُحْدِثُ الزَّهْوَ وَيُدْنِي مِنَ الْغِرَّةِ [الْعِزَّةِ]
enWisdom: Commendation causes vainglory and brings one closer to heedlessness

Wisdom: احْتَرِسُوا مِنْ سَوْرَةِ الْإِطْرَاءِ وَالْمَدْحِ فَإِنَّ لَهُمَا رِيحاً خَبِيثَةً فِي الْقَلْبِ
enWisdom: Be on your guard against excessive flattery and praise for indeed these two have a foul odour in the heart

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالْإِعْجَابَ وَحُبَّ الْإِطْرَاءِ فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ مِنْ أَوْثَقِ فُرَصِ الشَّيْطَانِ
enWisdom: Keep away from self-conceit and love for praise, for these are the strongest opportunities for Satan

Wisdom: حُبُّ النَّبَاهَةِ رَأْسُ [أُسُ‏] كُلِّ بَلِيَّةٍ
enWisdom: Love of fame is the cornerstone of every affliction

Wisdom: حُبُّ الْإِطْرَاءِ وَالْمَدْحِ مِنْ أَوْثَقِ فُرَصِ الشَّيْطَانِ
enWisdom: Love for compliments and praise is from the surest opportunities of Satan

Wisdom: إِنَّ مَادِحَكَ لَخَادِعٌ [إن مادحك الخاع‏] لِعَقْلِكَ غَاشٌّ لَكَ فِي نَفْسِكَ بِكَاذِبِ الْإِطْرَاءِ وَزُورِ الثَّنَاءِ فَإِنْ حَرَمْتَهُ نَوَالَكَ أَوْ مَنَعْتَهُ إِفْضَالَكَ وَسَمَكَ بِكُلِّ فَضِيحَةٍ وَنَسَبَكَ إِلَى كُلِّ قَبِيحَةٍ
enWisdom: Verily the person who praises you is surely a deceiver of your intellect, [and] a cheater who cheats you about yourself with false compliments and spurious praise; so if you deprive him of your grant or withhold from him your favour, he will label you with every scandal and will attribute every ugly act to you

Wisdom: أَقْبَحُ الصِّدْقِ ثَنَاءُ الرَّجُلِ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: The ugliest truth is a person’s praise for himself

Wisdom: إِذَا مَدَحْتَ فَاخْتَصِرْ
enWisdom: When you praise, be brief

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ مَغْرُورٍ بِحُسْنِ الْقَوْلِ فِيهِ
enWisdom: How many a person is deluded by the good that is spoken about him

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ مَفْتُونٍ بِالثَّنَاءِ عَلَيْهِ
enWisdom: How many a person is thrilled by the praise showered upon him

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ الثَّنَاءِ مَلَقٌ يُحْدِثُ الزَّهْوَ وَيُدْنِي مِنَ الْعِزَّةِ [الْغِرَّةِ]
enWisdom: Excessive praise is flattery; it causes vainglory and brings one closer to heedlessness

Wisdom: مَنْ مَدَحَكَ فَقَدْ ذَبَحَكَ
enWisdom: One who praises you has [actually] slaughtered you

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تُثْنِيَ عَلَى أَحَدٍ بِمَا لَيْسَ فِيهِ فَإِنَّ فِعْلَهُ يَصْدُقُ عَنْ وَصْفِهِ وَيُكَذِّبُكَ
enWisdom: Beware of praising anyone for something that is not in him, for indeed his action affirms his attribute and belies you

Wisdom: طَلَبُ الثَّنَاءِ بِغَيْرِ اسْتِحْقَاقٍ خُرْقٌ
enWisdom: Seeking praise without deserving it is foolishness

Wisdom: مَنْ شَكَرَكَ مِنْ غَيْرِ صَنِيعَةٍ فَلَا تَأْمَنْ ذَمَّهُ مِنْ غَيْرِ قَطِيعَةٍ
enWisdom: When someone thanks you without [your having done him] a good turn, then do not consider yourself safe from his censure without any breach

Wisdom: مَنْ شُكِرَ عَلَى غَيْرِ إِحْسَانٍ [مَعْرُوفٍ‏] ذُمَّ عَلَى غَيْرِ إِسَاءَةٍ
enWisdom: One who shows gratitude without any favor, censures without any wrongdoing?

Wisdom: مَنْ مَدَحَكَ بِمَا لَيْسَ فِيكَ فَهُوَ خَلِيقٌ أَنْ يَذُمَّكَ بِمَا لَيْسَ فِيكَ
enWisdom: One who praises you for what is not in you is indeed likely to blame you for that which you have not done

Wisdom: مَنْ أُثْنِيَ عَلَيْهِ بِمَا لَيْسَ فِيهِ سُخِرَ بِهِ
enWisdom: One who is praised for that which is not in him is ridiculed by it

Wisdom: مَنْ مَدَحَكَ بِمَا لَيْسَ فِيكَ فَهُوَ ذَمٌّ لَكَ إِنْ عَقَلْتَ
enWisdom: Whoever praises you for that which is not in you, then it is actually a criticism of you if you think about it

Wisdom: مَادِحُ الرَّجُلِ بِمَا لَيْسَ فِيهِ مُسْتَهْزِئٌ بِهِ
enWisdom: The one who praises a person for that which is not in him is mocking him

Wisdom: مَادِحُكَ بِمَا لَيْسَ فِيكَ مُسْتَهْزِئٌ بِكَ فَإِنْ لَمْ تُسْعِفْهُ بِنَوَالِكَ بَالَغَ فِي ذَمِّكَ وَهِجَائِكَ
enWisdom: The one who praises you for that which is not in you is [actually] mocking you, and if you do not give him that which fulfils his wants, he will be excessive in his blame and defamation of you
